New Records: Kylian Mbappé scored the first European Championship goal for France, breaking a long-standing own goal record by Austria's Maximilian Woeber
Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored the opening goal by penalty kick
Robert Lewandowski equalized for Poland with a penalty after a VAR decision
Poland was awarded a penalty following a challenge by Dayot Upamecano
Pre-Game Insights: Kylian Mbappé returned to the pitch wearing a mask after breaking his nose
Antoine Griezmann was surprisingly dropped from the starting lineup
Post-Match Reflections: France finished second in Group D, setting up a potential clash with Belgium, Romania, or Ukraine in the last-16 round
Poland's elimination prior to this match was already confirmed
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under sweltering conditions
Lukasz Skorupski played in goal for Poland instead of Wojciech Szczesny, who is set to retire after the tournament
Others: This was the first match where France scored a goal after an own goal by Austria's Maximilian Woeber in the previous game
